conclusion: Setup of the problem with charges at A, B, and later at C
Initial configuration with charges at A and B only
Distance from center O to each vertex is r = a/(2√3)
Electric field at O due to charges at A and B is E
Field vectors from charges at A and B are directed away from positive charges
Horizontal components of field vectors cancel out due to symmetry
Vertical components add up to produce a net field pointing upward
Adding charge -q at C creates an electric field pointing toward C
Field vector from C to O is opposite to vertical components from A and B
Field from charge C at point O has same magnitude as vertical component from A and B
Field from C will cancel out the field from A and B, resulting in electric field strength of 0 at O
Potential due to a point charge q at distance r is V = k·q/r
Potential at O is sum of potentials from all three charges
Total potential at O = k·q/r + k·q/r - k·q/r = k·q/r
Final answer: electric field strength at O is 0, electric potential at O is k·q/r
